Meta.ShortDescription: A disease in which not enough RBCs are present due to a lack of vitamin B-12

Symptoms.Symptom: Sores at the corner of the mouth

Causes.Cause: Lack of gastric intrinsic factor (GIF) due to autoimmune attack on the cells that make GIF in the stomach

Prognoses.Prognosis: A person with well-treated PA can live a healthy life. Failure to diagnose and treat in time, however, may result in permanent neurological damage, excessive fatigue, depression, memory loss, and other complications.
In severe cases, the neurological complications of pernicious anemia can lead to death - hence the name, "pernicious", meaning deadly.
